StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateDocumentRecord]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@DocumentID uniqueidentifier, @DocumentTypeID int, @FileName varchar(200), @Keywords varchar(100), @UpdateUserId uniqueidentifier, @RssOrgId int, @MonthFor smallint, @YearFor smallint, @DayFor smallint, @FileDoc varbinary(max), @ChangeVer smallint, @UserDisplayName varchar(60)
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [RSSOSS].[USMC].[DocumentUpload] WHERE DocumentTypeID = @DocumentTypeID AND RssOrgID=@RssOrgId AND YearFor=@YearFor AND MonthFor=@MonthFor AND DayFor=@DayFor AND ChangeVer=@ChangeVer) BEGIN -- if @intCount > 0, then the Record already exists. UPDATE. UPDATE [RSSOSS].[USMC].[DocumentUpload] SET UploadDate = GETDATE(), UploadBy = @UpdateUserId, FileDocument = @FileDoc, FileName = @FileName, KeywordsDesc = @Keywords, UserDisplayName = @UserDisplayName WHERE DocumentTypeID = @DocumentTypeID AND RssOrgID=@RssOrgId AND YearFor=@YearFor AND MonthFor=@MonthFor AND DayFor=@DayFor AND ChangeVer=@ChangeVer
END ELSE BEGIN -- if @intCount = 0, then the Record does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO [RSSOSS].[USMC].[DocumentUpload] (ID, DocumentTypeID, FileName, KeywordsDesc, UploadDate, UploadBy, LastViewedDate, LastViewedBy, RssOrgId, YearFor, MonthFor, DayFor, FileDocument, ChangeVer, UserDisplayName) VALUES (@DocumentID, @DocumentTypeID, @FileName, @Keywords, GETDATE(), @UpdateUserId, GETDATE(), @UpdateUserId, @RssOrgId, @YearFor, @MonthFor, @DayFor, @FileDoc, @ChangeVer, @UserDisplayName ) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
